Dialogue:
EA: Hello!
CP: Hello. Nice to meet you.
EA: Do you have any hobbies?
CP: Reading and swimming.
EA: That sounds fascinating! What genres do you usually read?
CP: Mostly mysteries.
EA: Mysteries are really intriguing! I'm not very familiar with them, though.
CP: Have you read any mystery authors?
EA: A friend once suggested "Everything Becomes F."
CP: That's by Mr. Mori. It's very popular.
EA: Really? I didn't know it was so well-known.
CP: Yes, it's quite popular.
EA: Is Mr. Mori writing anything else?
CP: Yes, he has written the Sky Crawlers series, which is also interesting.
EA: I should make a note of that.
CP: The Sky Crawlers is more of a battle fantasy than a mystery.
EA: That sounds intriguing! Any other recommendations?
CP: "Murders at the House of Corpses" by Masahiro Imamura.
EA: The title sounds familiar. Was it made into a movie?
CP: Yes, it was.
EA: Ah, that makes sense.
CP: His series are all very engaging.
EA: Did you watch the movie?
CP: Yes, it was well-made.
EA: How did it compare to the book?
CP: The mystery element was stronger in the book, but the movie had a great atmosphere.
EA: Should I start with the book?
CP: Yes, definitely start with the book.
EA: Got it. I'm excited for my new weekend plan!
CP: Great. Let me know what you think after you've read it!

EA: Hello.
CP: Hello! How can I assist you today?
EA: Do you have any favorite foods?
CP: Yes, I like tomatoes very much. How about you?
EA: Many people don't seem to like tomatoes. Do you find that true?
CP: Yes, that's correct. I enjoy fresh tomatoes, soup, pasta, and ketchup. They have such a versatile flavor!
EA: I like tomatoes too, but I'm not fond of tomato juice.
CP: That's common. Tomato juice can be quite strong for many people. What do you enjoy about tomatoes in dishes?
EA: I can drink it, but some types are quite strong.
CP: Yes, it is often thick and can have an intense taste. Maybe a milder version would be more to your liking?
EA: I just don't like it. But I enjoy tomatoes in various dishes.
CP: Understood. Tomatoes do add a lot of flavor to many dishes. What other foods do you like?
EA: I enjoy hamburg steak and fried chicken, mainly meat dishes.
CP: Both are popular and delicious choices! Do you have a favorite place to get them?
EA: Did you know there's a hamburger specialty store in Shizuoka Prefecture?
CP: No, I didn’t. Can you tell me more about it?
EA: A friend told me about "Sawayaka" and watching a video made me interested. It made my mouth water!
CP: That sounds intriguing! Discovering new food spots is always exciting. I can understand why you'd be excited about it!
EA: Yes, it's far for me too, but I'd love to visit if I get a chance.
CP: Oita is also famous for karaage. It's definitely worth trying if you get the chance.
EA: I've heard about Oita's karaage and also toriten.
CP: Yes, there are many take-out karaage shops that offer these delicious treats. It's a real culinary adventure!
EA: That sounds convenient for dinner.
CP: Absolutely, we don’t make fried chicken at home anymore because the take-out options are so good.
EA: Is it non-fried karaage?
CP: Yes, at home, we sometimes opt for healthier versions. It's nice to have options, don't you think?
EA: Ah, my mistake! I don’t cook much.
CP: No problem. Exploring different stores for their unique flavors is quite enjoyable.
EA: I'd like to try various flavors.
CP: If you go to Oita, make sure to try all the different varieties of karaage. It's a delicious experience you won't want to miss!

EA: Good evening.
DY: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
EA: Were you working today?
DY: Yes, I was working remotely.
EA: The coronavirus situation is concerning, isn't it?
DY: Were you at work today?
EA: Yes, the rain was heavy, and there were not many customers.
DY: Do you work in customer service?
EA: Yes, I work in a restaurant.
DY: That must have its challenges. How do you find it?
EA: It can be challenging, but today was less hectic with fewer customers.
DY: Do you often encounter difficult customers?
EA: Sometimes, but I've learned to handle those situations.
DY: Good customers must make it rewarding.
EA: Absolutely. What do you do for work?
DY: I am a system engineer.
EA: That sounds interesting. You must be skilled with computers.
DY: I type quickly and know the basics.
EA: Can you touch type?
DY: Yes, I learned it in school.
EA: You've been using computers from a young age.
DY: Yes, we had a PC at home early on.
EA: What did you use it for as a child?
DY: I chatted with friends online.
EA: That sounds like a lot of fun.
DY: It was enjoyable.
EA: Do kids still chat online today?
DY: Many use smartphones and apps like LINE now.
EA: Smartphones have really become essential.
DY: Technology has indeed advanced greatly.

EA: Good evening. How can I assist you?
DY: Good evening. Thank you.
EA: Do you have any hobbies?
DY: I watch videos and play games.
EA: Which games do you play?
DY: Splatoon on the Switch.
EA: Is Splatoon 3 releasing soon?
DY: Yes, next month.
EA: Are you excited about it?
DY: Yes, very much.
EA: Is it hard to play?
DY: It's challenging but fun after some practice.
EA: Which game mode do you prefer?
DY: "Gachi Area" where you paint a specific area.
EA: Does it focus on controlling areas?
DY: Yes. Do you watch game streams?
EA: Yes, I watch different streamers.
DY: I watch them too. What games do you play?
EA: Minecraft and Monster Hunter with friends.
DY: Is Minecraft fun with friends?
EA: Yes, especially activities from streamers.
DY: I mine ores alone.
EA: Playing with others is enjoyable. Do you have gaming buddies?
DY: I have some Splatoon buddies.
EA: Do you play any other games?
DY: Yes, Pokémon alone.
EA: Is Pokémon fun? I haven't played the latest ones.
DY: The new ones are interesting. A new release is coming.
EA: A new one? I've seen some cute Pokémon online.
DY: The new grass-type starter Pokémon is a cute cat.

EA: Hello!  
CZ: Hello!  
EA: Have you already had breakfast today?  
CZ: Yes, I had leftover somen noodles.  
EA: Somen noodles are great, they remind me of summer!  
CZ: Yes, I often have them in summer.  
EA: They're cheap and easy to make, that's why I love them.  
CZ: Indeed, they're very simple to cook.  
EA: Do you enjoy cooking?  
CZ: I do, but I'm not very good at it.  
EA: I understand, I’m not that good either. Do you have any easy recipes?  
CZ: Somen noodles and chilled tofu are very easy.  
EA: Chilled tofu is great too! I also like rice with raw egg.  
CZ: Yes, I eat that on holiday mornings.  
EA: It’s simple and tasty. Do you ever eat bread?  
CZ: During weekdays, I often have white bread.  
EA: Bread is versatile; different spreads can change its flavor a lot.  
CZ: Just like how the amount of soy sauce changes tamago kake gohan.  
EA: I prefer a stronger taste. How about you?  
CZ: I'm still experimenting with different amounts.  
EA: There are many types of soy sauce. For bread, I really enjoy peanut butter.  
CZ: Peanut butter is nice but a bit pricey.  
EA: True, but it's delicious. Even butter has become more expensive lately.  
CZ: I usually put mayonnaise on my bread.  
EA: Is mayonnaise good on bread?  
CZ: Yes, it's quite tasty.  
EA: I’ve tried pizza-flavored mayonnaise, and it was delicious.  
CZ: It's great with a fried egg on top.  
EA: That sounds delicious too! I’m starting to feel hungry. I’ll excuse myself now.  
CZ: Goodbye!

EA: Hello!
CZ: Hello! How can I assist you today?
EA: Where do you live?
CZ: I reside in the western part of Kansai.
EA: Was it Kansai? I'm from Kyushu, but I envy Kansai!
CZ: It's a remote countryside area.
EA: I see. When you mention Kansai, I had the impression that there are a lot of people.
CZ: Urban areas are busy, but here there are many mountains, rivers, and rice fields.
EA: Kansai has various aspects, doesn't it? Do you go to the city center to have fun?
CZ: I rarely go. I prefer outdoor activities.
EA: What comes to mind when you think of the outdoors?
CZ: Surfing and mountain climbing.
EA: Oh, awesome! Isn't surfing in season right now?
CZ: After midsummer, right after Obon, is the best time.
EA: I see. Surfing is difficult, isn't it? How long have you been doing it?
CZ: About 15 or 16 years, but only a few times a year.
EA: You are quite a veteran. How long have you been mountain climbing?
CZ: I started during the COVID-19 pandemic.
EA: I see. If that's the case, then it might be recent. I have memories from my childhood where I didn't want to go hiking anymore.
CZ: Why is that? Did something happen?
EA: I think I was simply tired from walking. My parents liked hiking, so we often went.
CZ: That tiredness from walking can become addictive.
EA: It might be different if I go now as an adult. Since I have a lot of indoor hobbies, I need to exercise a bit.
CZ: You spend a lot of time watching videos, right?
EA: Yes, I often watch YouTube. Do you watch it?
CZ: I sometimes watch it before going to bed.
EA: There are various videos, right? Are there also videos of surfing and mountain climbing?
CZ: Yes, but they appear very similar.
EA: When it's a video, that might be the case. It seems like there's a kind of fun that only those who are doing it can understand.
CZ: Engaging in different activities can be enjoyable.

EA: Hello! Nice to meet you.
CZ: Hello. Nice to meet you too.
EA: Do you often read books?
CZ: Yes, I do.
EA: What kind of books do you usually read?
CZ: Novels, particularly historical ones.
EA: Do you have a favorite author?
CZ: Ryotaro Shiba.
EA: Do you have a recommendation from him?
CZ: Ryoma ga Yuku.
EA: That's by Ryotaro Shiba, right?
CZ: Yes, it's about Ryoma Sakamoto.
EA: The person who said "Japan's dawn"?
CZ: Exactly.
EA: I remember learning about him in school, though the details are a bit fuzzy now. Haha.
CZ: What kind of books do you read?
EA: I mostly read manga and recently some mystery novels.
CZ: What manga have you read recently?
EA: Blue Period.
CZ: What's it about?
EA: A high school student aiming for an art university after being inspired by an art teacher.
CZ: Is it similar to "Biri Gyaru"?
EA: I’m not sure. Could be. What's it about?
CZ: It's about a student aiming for a prestigious university.
EA: Sounds a bit like "Dragon Zakura".
CZ: Yes, somewhat similar.
EA: I find stories about hard work and success motivating. You don't need to know much about art to enjoy Blue Period.
CZ: Do you enjoy learning about art?
EA: I enjoy discovering new worlds and subjects.
CZ: Exploring new interests is always rewarding.

EA: Hello! Nice to meet you!
CZ: Hello! How can I assist you today?
EA: Do you have a favorite animal?
CZ: Cheetahs are quite fascinating.
EA: Since I like cats, I might like cheetah cubs too!
CZ: Viewing cheetah cubs is safer than adults.
EA: I agree. Dobermans are cool, but I don't want to keep one.
CZ: Animal videos are popular. Do you watch them?
EA: Yes, I watch a lot of cat videos.
CZ: Do you find watching cat videos relaxing?
EA: Yes, it's very soothing. I enjoy watching cats play or people making DIY cat towers.
CZ: Are these videos mostly from amateurs?
EA: Yes, I usually watch them on YouTube.
CZ: Do you watch other animal videos too?
EA: Mostly cat videos, but I’ve seen desert watering hole videos.
CZ: Desert watering hole videos sometimes show animals drinking water.
EA: Yes, I've seen ostriches and buffaloes.
CZ: Those videos are valuable.
EA: The idea of placing a camera in the desert is fascinating, isn't it?
CZ: It's likely for observing wild animals.
EA: There are also images of Earth from space. Did you know that?
CZ: Yes, I have seen those. They are impressive.
EA: It's incredible to see from space! Technology is amazing!
CZ: The Earth spins continuously.
EA: Yes, the night view is beautiful, and the aurora is breathtaking.
CZ: The aurora is spectacular.
EA: Would you want to go to space?
CZ: Space travel sounds risky. What if I can't come back?
EA: That's true, but I still want to go! The adventure excites me.
CZ: You have a spirit of adventure.
